Reviews.Content: Perfect for Christmas Markets Stayed in the City Hotel for 2 nights with 8 of the girls!! We had three clean rooms with great views. We never made the breakfast but heard that it was great. Very close to the markets and although it's said to be in the red light district, we saw and heard nothing out of the way. Rooms were spacious and clean. All staff had English and were very helpful!
Reviews.Author: caitnibhaoill

Reviews.Content: bed bugs in a 3 star hotel we reserved a place as it was very centralbut the personnel doesnt speak englishthere was 2 lamps in a room for 3 persons the third lamp de chevet didn t have a rallonge, and we had to tell it 3 times during 2 days to have it fixedthe room was fool of bedbugs back in my country we are being treatedthe reception is incapable of making any reservation to a restaurant they dont understand englishthey do your room un jour sur deuxthe carpets are plein de tachesthis hotel should have 1 starthey have been informed by former travellers abour the bedbugs and as a result we have traveled with the same bugsthere should be a way to punish this hotelbedbugs in a 3 star hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: samiye

Reviews.Content: Cheap and a great location. This is a great travellers hotel.The rooms are large and the showers are small but i always have found both to be clean.Yes there there are brothels nearby but all you see are buildings with a doorway. Unlike Amsterdam and Hamburg you dont see the wares.There is also a bar accross the road where people drink on the street but i have never had a problem in the area.The only people who go to the brothels are locals and there are no problems in the streets and no loud noise to consider.There is no view to speak of but there arent many hotels that do and you are not there to sit in your room and look out of the window.There is no AC but there are good fans in the rooms.Breakfast is included and a typical german meal. There is yoghurt, fresh fruit, many types of bread, cheese smallgoods, eggs, spreads and condiments, juices, tea coffee etc.The dining area has been expanded to fit in more tables.Close by are small supermarkets and internet cafes.The Konstablewache (train station) is close by and trains to the airport stop here. Again there is plenty of shops etc there.It is close to Zeil (shopping area) which is above the Konstablewache which is a 5 min walk if you dawdle.I have stayed here a number of times and if you want the service of a five star place then book a five star place. I simply check in say hello every time i drop off my key or pick it up but i am not there to converse with the staff and once you have breakfast i am away from there until i want to crash. I havent had the problems others have had and would stay there again when i am in frankfurt.I booked through octopus travel and it is about the same rate when i booked
Reviews.Author: Nibzee

Reviews.Content: Bed bugs - Avoid at all cost On first glance this hotel seemed like a bargain but on our first night we were asleep for about 2 hours when my friend woke up complaining about being bitten by 'something'. Upon further investigation, our beds were crawling with bed bugs. Big, fat, hungry bed bugs that were full of our blood. We told the guy on the desk but were only offered another room - which we turned down for obvious reasons. We left the hotel at 3am and went to the main train station to sleep on their concrete floor. Despite several attempts to speak to the management, they have ignored me. Do not stay here.
Reviews.Author: redleader333

Reviews.Content: good location hotel was nice,for the reasonable rates did not expect a luxurious stay.hotel a bit shabby from outside,our room was not in main bulding but almost like apartments beside main entrance.very clean which was my main priorty.location is very central and although there was a few adult shops near by no one bother us.only stayed three nights would go back again for a flying visit due to location but not 4 any longer than three days.
Reviews.Author: furbykiki

Reviews.Content: this one is OK for ONE night This hotel is very easy to find, from this airport you can take a train, and its like 6th stop. Hotel is located close from pretty much everything, shopping and old town (rommer platz)Room was very small, they do need a make-over BAD! Bathroom very tiny, rooms are small, no access to the internet, BUT right across the street there is internet cafe (not free)The only good thing to say is-VERY generous breakfast that is included with your stay-yummy!
Reviews.Author: dreams2008

Reviews.Content: a lot of insects in the bed a lot of bed bugs, terrible experience, I have still a lot of signs on my body ....
Reviews.Author: francmail

Reviews.Content: Great Location Me and my girlfriend spend two nights in this 3 star hotel which is, actually, in the middle of Frankfurt. You can walk five minutes to the main shopping street and to see the sights it麓s not more than ten minutes. The neighborhood is quite scary at night, but we didn麓t have any problem at all so that was ok from our point of view. Hotel is quite cheap, but I麓am not sure who gave three stars because this is actually two star hotel (owned by russia people btw). Room was ok (cheap look), but you can see some dust on the furniture/carpet and bathroom was so small that was hardly to move inside. It seems that cleaning is not the most popular job for staff. There were also some problem with breakfest (nice bufet, lots of things but you have to get up early). We were missing some bread so I asked receptionist/waitress if she could bring more and she just go to the another guest and asked him Do you mind if I take your bread, because we don麓t have more which was quite funny but not polite and professional. So the main positive things are price and location.
Reviews.Author: jakub_furst

Reviews.Content: OK We stayed at City Hotel Frankfurt for 2 nights in October 2007. In terms of distance to the different points of interest, the location was excellent. However, the neighborhood was pretty shabby. The trinkenhalle nearby was crowded and noisy, and the view from our room was dreadful. Still, we spent much of our time roaming through the city, so it really didn't matter. The street below was quite noisy at night, so we had to keep the window shut. The breakfast area was a little too small, and some people had to wait in line in order to eat. Still, we wouldn't mind booking a room at this hotel again if we were to return to Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: Omoya

Reviews.Content: not as expected we expected higher hotel standard since it is rated as a 3 stars hotel... but it is actually a 2 stars. It's little and old, and located in a no-so-friendly neighbourhood. The bathroom was too small, we booked a room for 3 people, had to wait a couple of hours before it was ready (way beyond the check-in time) and when we finally got the room, the third bed wasn't made. We had to make it. And the sink broke, only with one hand put on it. The guy at the reception was very kind though.
Reviews.Author: silvi_c

Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay Me and my girlfriend stayed there a couple of days ago and our stay was very pleasant. The only negative thing was the precarious neighbourhood. There was a ''trinkenhalle'' just around the corner that was very crowded with drunken men around the clock. Another thing was the huge amount of the hocker houses on both streets that led to the town. Some nights we woke up many times because of the constant disturbance in the street and we were at the third floor!The breakfest and the service was delightfully friendly and the rooms were cozy. The lift was very old but worked anyway and the tub station was just around the corner.We would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Focolopes

Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and nothing else I stayed at the hotel 3 nights in July 2005. The room was four-star standard, clean and spacious. Unfortunately this was the only positive feature I found apart from the central location.The service is terrible. Most members of the staff (especially at the reception) are really rough and unpolite. It is rare they say to you even good morning or good bye (I have never had such a bad experience). The breakfast room is so small that I had to give up to have my breakfast 2 of 3 morning.The neighborhood is run down. I expected a quiet sidestreet close to the Zeil and the Cathedral but.... Just opposite th茅 hotel backyard there at least 3 brothels open 24 hours a day; near the entrance there is a bar full of drugs dealers and thugs. It was very noisy durning the night. I could not get asleep (even with my window closed) on Friday and Saturaday night.The hotel can be considered very cheap for a 3 stars (I payed only 45 EURO per night). But after my bad experience I strongly recommend not to go there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel but undesireable neighborhood The hotel itself was great. The rooms were clean and the the breakfast was good. The neighborhood was not very great. There were sex trade workers diplaying themselves in the window just down the street from the hotel and there was a drinking establishment right next to the hotel which was frequented by men well into the night. It was consequently noisy and I had to keep my window closed so as not hear the ruccous.
Reviews.Author: catsailing

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, Bad Neighborhood We stayed in City Hotel Frankfurt for one night. Hotel has a parking lot which will fit 3 cars. Fortunately, we checked in early and received a parking spot.For three people, our room was spacious. Bathroom was a little small. Overall, the room was clean and comfortable.The local riff-raff congregated across the street from the hotel. We watched a few drug transactions from our window before the dealers realized that we were watching them. Breakfast was the standard European buffet. As mentioned in a previous review, the dining area was small (4 tables). After enjoying our breakfast, we checked-out without any problems. This hotel was fine for a short stay.
Reviews.Author: forensicsgirl

Reviews.Content: dangerous neighborhood I stayed in this small hotel dec 04, because it was supposed to be situated in a quiet sidestreet to the main frankfurt shopping street Zeil, it was not, - not far, but it is across the street of the city brothel, and a lot of caracters you would not like to meet, are gathered at the sidewalks around the hotel. There are no decent restaurant around. 5 - 10 minutes walk, and there are a few. The hotel it self was nice, pleasant large room. The hotel is runned by non-european immigrants.
Reviews.Author: Svein

Reviews.Content: Decent, inexpensive accommodation in Frankfurt's City Centre I stayed at the City Hotel, Allerheiligenstrasse 30 in Frankfurt over one weekend in November 2004. The hotel is new, that is, it was established only recently in August 2004. The building was built in the late 1960's. The reception desk is small, and there is a lift to the upper floors.The double rooms look like they were previously self-contained flatlets, which means that they're actually quite large (over 20 square metres) with large windows (very efficient sound proofing and outside blinds which are typical of German houses). They have a small hallway with a wardrobe, hooks for the coats and a large mirror. The bathroom is a bit on the small side with a shower cabin, hair dryer and a few toiletries (soap, shampoo, shower gel). Everything looks very new. The actual room is large and would satisfy a four-star standard (clean, bright, with a small fridge, desk, chair, armchair, chest of drawers, TV). The furnishings are made of dark wood, while the walls are painted in magnolia. The central heating was working very well, windows can be opened wide - in case it is too hot. As this hotel does not have a catering business, the breakfast is a bit on the modest side. In the breakfast area downstairs, there are four tables each with four chairs, which means that at peak times you might have to share a table with other guests. The buffet is very small - only two or three people can help themselves at any one time. The food is fine - crispy rolls, toast, jam, honey, cheese, ham or salami, cereals, juices, fruit, yoghurt, fresh coffee or tea. By and large, they offer all the foods you would expect from a breakfast buffet in a three-star hotel. It's only that the breakfast room is indeed very small and doesn't invite guests to stay and to read a newspaper after breakfast etc. The location of the hotel is not particularly attractive (mainly Turkish shops and bars) but safe for travellers and not too noisy. On the positive side, it's only a five-minute walk to the famous Zeil shopping street and about 10 - 15 minutes walk to Sachsenhausen, where Frankfurt's night life is at its best. Public transport (station Konstablerwache) is about 3 minutes on foot. Altogether I would recommend this hotel to travellers who desire a nice, spacious and comfortable room and who do not put too much emphasis on the breakfast. I booked via -------------- and paid 50 Euro per night for a double room. During trade fair times, of course, prices will be considerably higher.
Reviews.Author: Thorpe123
